lol.title: LoL
lol.header: If your account is registered, you can use these commands without appending a summoner name to have them trigger on your own summoner name.

commands.description: *Registers* your summoner name to your Discord ID.
Returns a summoner's account level.
Returns a summoner's top three mastery champions.
Returns data on a summoner's ladder rankings.
Returns the time elapsed since a summoner's last match.
Returns the time elapsed since a summoner's last ranked match.
Returns data on a summoner's role preference.
Returns data on a summoner's role preference in ranked play.
Returns data on a summoner's winrate.
Returns data on a summoner's ranked winrate.
Returns teams and masteries in a live match.
Returns teams, masteries, and ranks in a live match.
Links LoLWiki's entry on `champion`. Optionally, links to `ability` on the page.
Gets basic ranked info for players in your lobby.

admin.title: Admin Functions
admin.header: These commands require certain permissions. Administrator permissions give access to ALL admin commands.

commands.description: Changes Sobbot's server prefix.
Resets Sobbot's server prefix.
Flips a coin.
Rolls a die with `number` sides.
Returns a cute Sobble image.
Returns the answer to your expression.
Returns data on a given Pokedex entry.
Returns data on a given Pokemon.
Returns how long Sobbot has been running.
Returns when Sobbot last started.
Returns a random shade of blue.
Returns a random colour.
Returns info on `colour`.
Generates a rubik's scramble.
Returns current market data for `symbol`.
*Registers* your Discord ID to open your portfolio.
Returns your portfolio.
Updates your portfolio to have `count` shares of `symbol`.
Removes `symbol` from your portfolio.

spotify.title: Spotify Functions
spotify.desc: Create the perfect playlist with your friends
spotify.header: Commands with a # before their description require Manage Server permissions. However, you have full control over your contributions to a server's playlist, and can remove any track you've added without admin permissions. Invoke the info blurb for `serverplaylists` to learn more.

commands.description: Creates a server playlist, and sends the link.
Adds `song` to your server's playlist.
Gets a list of all server playlist tracks and contributors.
Gets a link to the server playlist.
#Renames the server playlist to `title`.
#Sets the server playlist description to `desc`.
#Sets the playlist cover to the attached image.
#Undos the newest addition to the playlist.
#Removes all occurences of `song` from the playlist.
#Deletes the server playlist. IRREVERSIBLE.

help.title: Help Functions
help.desc: Get info about me and my features

commands.description: Get a list of command directories.
Get a list of commands in `directory`.
Get a list of info pages on Sobbot's more niche features.
Get info on `topic`.
Get a link to Sobbot's Github repository.

bugs.title: Give Sobbot a Helping Hand
bugs.text:
Sobbot is a perpetual work in progress - new features are pushed out every once in a while, which can come with updates, reworks, and rehashes to older features. Naturally, this can cause them to break or not work as intended.
If you happen to come across any issues that aren't explained (such as rate limiting) or weird mistakes, please let me know ASAP so I can work on a fix! I can even credit you in the project readme if you'd like :grin:
Preferred contact methods:
**-Github Issues Page** (https://github.com/lucs100/sobbot/issues)
**-Discord** (<@312012475761688578>)

coins.title: About Stacking Soblecoins
coins.text:
Soblecoins are a fun way to be rewarded for using Sobbot! By *registering* your account with soblecoins, you can claim coins every few hours, send them to your friends, or wager them on minigames! You can't send soblecoins to a user unless you're both registered. As well, registered users have a small chance to passively earn soblecoins each time they send a message in a server with Sobbot. There are also items to buy in the shop, which enhance your Sobbot experience in different ways.
Soblecoins, of course, have no inherent value, they're just a fun currency to interact with Sobbot and your friends :)

ratelimit.title: Speed Kills
ratelimit.text:
The Riot API is a server allowing registered apps such as Sobbot to retrieve data from Riot's databases. Personal projects such as Sobbot have very strict rate limits:
**10 requests every second**
**100 requests every 2 minutes**
Apps which egreiously hit their rate limits can have their key banned from the API. Sobbot's functions are designed to have a kill switch in the case of hitting a rate limit and will never hit a rate limit in a single use. However, multiple uses of functions will often hit the rate cap. For example, `livematch` makes ~32 requests to the API. This isn't a problem, however, please avoid hitting the rate cap too much as it risks Sobbot reveiving a ban from Riot's API. Loss of this key would all but kill the project.

register.title: Help Sobbot Get to Know You
register.text: Some of Sobbot's command types allow you to *register* yourself for convenience. This isn't actually 'registering' an account, but rather adding your Discord ID and related info to the database so your data can be saved and updated later! The most common use of registration with Sobbot is the LoL commands - using the `register (summonerName)` command, you can link your summoner name to your Discord ID. The next time you use a LoL command, you won't have to type your summoner name - if you leave the `summonerName` parameter blank on any command, it'll automatically use your registered summoner name as a default. This is also true for other command subsets - check out their help embeds (`help`) for more info!

sp.title: Server Playlist Specifics
sp.text:
Sobbot's Spotify commands all involve the use of *Server Playlists*. These are Spotify playlists that any user in a server can contribute to and listen to! They're a fun way to collaborate with your friends on a playlist with all of your music tastes.
While only users with Manage Server permissions can use more destructive commands, you're allowed to delete any song that you have added to the playlist.
This can be done through either the `spdelete` or the `spundo` commands, provided that you were the user who added the song those commands are targeted at.
Keep in mind that while you can have multiple instances of a song in a playlist, deleting a song using one of those commands deletes ALL occurences of it from the playlist!
